p: For other communicable diseases, one study observed that meningitis occurred more during the dry-cool season [ 29]. Other studies on measles and meningitis found insignificant associations with mean temperature and rainfall [ 47]. For malnutrition, Salvacion observed high and low total rainfall months to be associated with rates of malnourished children under five years old [ 32]. In the summer months, the high mean temperature months were found to be negatively associated with the rate of malnourished children [ 32].
